entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 3:43PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Flooding Possible on the Tanana River Starting Monday... Glacial rivers draining the Alaska Range such as the Tanana, Chisana, and Nabesna Rivers are running near bankfull. entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Alaska Range; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued July 10 at 9:30PM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A High Surf Advisory remains in effect... * SURF...Surfs of 10 to 12 feet will continue to impact south and east facing shores due to a large southerly swell and moderate to fresh tradewinds. * TIMING...through the new week. * IMPACTS...strong rip currents and large surfs.

entry.title: Coastal Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 11:53PM PDT until July 12 at 12:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...KING TIDES WILL CAUSE MINOR COASTAL FLOODING AT LOW LYING SPOTS DURING HIGH TIDE MONDAY NIGHT... .The highest astronomical tides of the year, commonly referred to as the King Tides, will again impact the coast and bayshore Monday evening into Monday night and have historically resulted in the localized flooding of specific low lying areas each year.
entry.cap:areaDesc: North Bay Interior Valleys; San Francisco; San Francisco Bay Shoreline
